intro: Mitrasacme phascoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
